p: The effects of AKAV infection on developing embryos vary depending on the stage of gestation at which the dam becomes infected [ 131]. While, it is assumed this is similar for congenital SBV infection, further research is required to help elucidate the age-associated effects of SBV infection on developing embryos. The gestation-susceptible period for congenital AKAV infection is between day 28 and 56 days in small ruminants [ 55, 121, 122, 132], and between day 80 and 150 in cattle [ 56, 133â€“ 135]. However, experimental SBV infection in domestic ruminants during these dates has led to congenital malformations only in a very small number of cases (Table 2). This highlights the need for further research in this area; the development of suitable ruminant models to study SBV infection in developing embryos would be useful to help elucidate SBV pathogenesis.
